resources.string: Put in somethign like \"1 4 3.5 2\" to get the average or \"A B F C\" to get your GPA. (no quotation marks) Or check our HEEELP. (question mark in the upper right corner)
Grades go here: (Divide with a space)
Please divide each grade with a space. You can input numbers or letters. Both upper and lowercase are supported. Decimal numbers are supported. The -, + and / are supported.
can i get, to pass with

Sorry, looks like one of us has messed up. Try to put in somethign like \"1 4 3.5 2\" to get the average or \"A B F C\" to get your GPA. (no quotation marks) Or check our HEEELP. (question mark in the upper right corner)
\nThe rest is simply not gonna happen. You probably inputed something illogical. Try checking our HEEELP. (question mark in the upper right corner)
Take care for me about it being negative or positive
Higher number is a better grade
Lower number is a better grade
On auto, if letters are entered, we count, that a higher number is a better grade. Otherwise the opposite.
The \"0.\" before the decimal expression is required.
